a scientist who studies measurement: He is the state's only federally certified metrologist, educated in weights and measure. "It's very disappointing," said Armstrong, a metrologist who works in the airline's calibration systems.
More examplesFewer examplesA metrologist is a scientist who develops processes and systems used to measure objects.Young and Oznoff are metrologists, as in people who are well-versed in the weights of the world.The lab's chief metrologist explained that the lottery compares the numbers on the balls that come up winners throughout the year to their weights to determine whether any balls drop more frequently.
